description: Imitative. Kayaking sense from the onomatopoeic sound a kayak makes when it lands on the water after “ski jumping” the waterfall forming the backwash; generally attributed to whitewater kayaking aficionados in the eastern United States in the mid- to late 1970s.

verbs.description: boof (third-person singular simple present boofs, present participle boofing, simple past and past participle boofed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, kayaking) To make this kind of jump when whitewater kayaking.
(intransitive, fishing) (Of fish, especially barramundi) to surface quickly and catch prey by gulping, a behaviour which produces an audible sound.

verbs.description: boof (third-person singular simple present boofs, present participle boofing, simple past and past participle boofed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, slang) To have anal sex with someone, usually as the penetrative partner (possibly with negative connotations).
examples: Yeah, but not everybody's mother is a prostitute.  […]  For as long as I can remember she'd bring blokes home and make me stay in the bed and watch while she boofed 'em.  […]  One time she even made me do it to her.  […]  Jesus, man! You boofed your own mother?

entries.meaning: (transitive, prison slang) To conceal (a prohibited item) in one's rectum.
examples: He was attempting to commit an act called boofing. Boofing is when an inmate secretes a hidden item inside his rectum.
"No, Gee, seriously though, my man saw him boofing this on the visit." He raises his hand, showing me a ball of something wrapped in plastic with a little shit on it.
DB: What do you mean, like, having a brewsky? Or boofing?

verbs.description: boof (third-person singular simple present boofs, present participle boofing, simple past and past participle boofed)

entries.meaning: To get something wrong or make a mistake.

verbs.description: boof (third-person singular simple present boofs, present participle boofing, simple past and past participle boofed)

entries.meaning: (of hair) To puff out in a voluminous way.
examples: Having one's "hair done" means so many things these days. Not too long ago, it entailed a wash, a trim, and a boofing up.
